title: Great inner city farm
text: Great local inner city farm, the cafe serves really good fun, street parking is available if you are lucky .

title: Best pizza for miles
text: Heard many good things about this place so was dying to give it ago . It did not disappoint! The pizza sizes are massive and very yum . I just had ham and cheese, there was also cheese in the crust was a nice surprise! Will definitely be back for more .

title: Best Of Athens
text: This is what Athens is all about and we were not disappointed. Sadly the place was full of tourists but that cannot be helped . But it was definitely worth the hike up the hill , the views are absolutely breathtaking.

title: Deep in history
text: Fantastic and very informative museum. This is perfect to visit after being up in the Acropolis for a few hours

title: Great stay
text: Perfect walking distance to all the major attractions and restaurants around Athens . The hotel services excellent breakfast and fresh oranges juice which is spot on. Only down side is the rooms are slightly weird set up with the shower and toilet. The shower needs a proper draining system as it completely smells not very pleasant.

title: Fantastic find
text: Recently found this wonderful place during a stay in the cotswolds out of the blue. What a great find it was . The pub host was very welcoming and the pub had a great atmosphere , would be lovely to stay during the winter as it had a proper open We both had the lasagna which was very meaty yum yum . Definitely visiting again .

title: Great amphitheatre
text: Visited when it was pouring with rain not the best for photos but can't control the weather . Very impressive amphitheatre and the tour below the theatre was very informative.

title: Great place for cocktails
text: Fully taken advantage of Happy Hour with a friend for birthday drinks. Self distance in full.operation and booking a head required.

title: Great day down the farm
text: Great few hours spent at this great farm, visiting the animals who you are able to stroke but not hold to covid.

title: Great day out
text: Fantastic day trip to see a large range of wild animal. Plenty of wild space to be able to self distance. Quite a few places closed off due to covid.

title: Birthday Get Away
text: Fantastic hotel situated in a typical Cotswolds town. Within perfect driving distance of cotswolds attractions. The hotel is following all covid 19 guidelines and the staff are very friends and welcoming. The restaurant serves wonderful cocktails and food .

title: Standard
text: Went during a busy Sunday lunch time, served was quick and food arrived very quickly, makes you think do they just warm it up in the microwave! Had duck in a plum sauce with pasta was tasty but could make it at home .

title: Good find !
text: Went here recently for lunch with a friend . The food was awesome and delicious! Will definitely be back soon! The lunch time deal is definitely worth a try !

title: Adequate
text: Went here for lunch with a group of friends , I ordered Chicken tikka curry , everyone else had a lasagna and chicken with waffles . Was ok for what we paid . Service was good until we had to wait more than 20 minutes for one dessert, the pub wasnâ€™t even that busy ! Wonâ€™t be rushing back in a hurry.

title: Hotel beach was better.
text: Visited this beach for a few hours as everyone raved about it, our hotel beach (Skiathos Princess ) was better . Quite a fair bit of rubbish on the beach which was sad , free toilets and decent restaurant, have to pay for sun beds mind.

title: Fantastic beach
text: Beautiful beach , very peaceful until the other tourist come. More pebbles than sand so canâ€™t walk barefooted easily . Can only get to by boat ..

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: I canâ€™t rate this hotel enough ! Absolutely fantastic beach , service and food is out of this world , only problem wasnâ€™t here for long enough ! A week just isnâ€™t long enough ! The staff canâ€™t do enough for you , the food changes every day which was great , so much choice and variety Hotel is right on the beach which was quiet and very relaxing !

title: Good location for concert at Motorpoint
text: Stayed here during trip to see Olly Murs at the Motorpoint. Hotel is across the road so excellent location. Hotel is very basic , get what you pay for . Hotel cost includes full English breakfast and WiFi , WiFi didnâ€™t work for me , make fact too many people using it .

title: Excellent food
text: Been here several times , always good service and selection of food. My fav being cinnamon pineapple

title: Excellent find
text: Went here on the way to a concert at The Motorpoint, had a tuna sandwich and pastry was very yum . Excellent service and very good value for money.

title: Tapas in oxford
text:
Was in oxford for the day and wanted to use our tastecard. Came across this tapas/bar which seemed very reasonable price. Nicely decorated inside and service was excellent, we ordered
The cheese board , meatballs , cheese croquets, Spanish omelette and halloumi and pomegranate Salad which was delicious! And the fresh orange juice was lovely too!

title: Hidden Gem
text: Went to oxford for the day when we came across this hidden little gem. Excellent food and service . Had avocado and prawns to start with was the biggest portion of prawns had as a starter out before. For main had lasagna was very yummy, plenty of mince and cheese . Absolutely loved the decor of the restaurant the map of Italy on the ceiling was superb. Well definitely be back when next in oxford.

title: Superbreak Stay
text: Stayed here for two nights as part of a mini break. Ideal location as only 15 mins drive from Stratford Upon Avon. Breakfast was one of the best I have had , well plenty of variety. Hotel restaurant offers decent food in with lovely position sizes and staff are very efficient. The rooms could do with being updated as they are looking tiredness and the bathroom has seen better days. But decent enough for what you pay to say here.

title: Wonderful
text: Recently visited whilst trying to find somewhere for dinner , remembered the place had recently been under new management, so thought would give it ago . We certainly were not disappointed! Friendly staff , most excellent food , and most important dog friendly. We were so impressed we have booked to return on Motherâ€™s Day .

title: Annual Visit to Colesbourne
text: Visited whilst the snowdrops were out over 50 varieties was pretty to say on the weekend we saw them. But the highlight has to be tea and cake ! Wonderful cakes made by volunteers .

title: Lovely Pub Lunch
text: On the way to Colesbourne Snow Drops stopped here for a pub lunch I had whitebaite and seafood risotto was perfectly cooked and position sizes were satisfactory. Pub staff were very efficient and friendly . Would definitely go again .

title: Slice of heaven
text: Heard many things about this cafe so finally went ! The cafe was a lot smaller than I imagined it would be was quite crowded when we went . Order a chocolate double cookie and brownie latte and cappuccino. Sizes of drinks were a lot smaller than I thought they would be and not very warm. Definitely a good spot for chocolate lovers but I wonâ€™t be going back in a hurry.

title: Day trip to Charlecote
text:
As members of NT we love to visit properties on visits around the country . On a recent visit to the area we visited Charlecote Park House and Gardens. Walking around the gardens was
Most wonderful when we spotted the deer. We did a tour of the gates which was very informative the guide (Judy think her name was ) gave us plenty of information and history . In side the house which was self guided but information points were around the rooms was enjoyable.

We visited the orangery for lunch was slightly pricey but decent enough but the cakes were to die for .

title: Little taste of Greece!
text:
Currently visiting Stratford Upon Avon and wanted to explore an independent eatery whilst in the town. We hadnâ€™t pre booked when we arrived at the restaurant but received a very warm welcome and often several tables to choice from. We selected DOLMADES* â€“ stuffed vine leaves, SPANACOPITA (v) â€“ spinach & cheese parcels for starter for Main we all had MOUSSAKA*
Layers of minced beef, aubergine, courgeï¿½e & potato topped with a creamy Bechamel Sauce. Served with oregano chips & salad. All the food was superb only problem was didnâ€™t have enough space for dessert ! The serve and friendliness of staff could not fault, will definitely recommend to others , can not wait to visit again .

title: Disappointed
text: Have been going here for many years but the zoo is getting more expensive but sadly the zoo doesn't seem to changing much. Would be good to make the enclosures bigger and give the animals more space.

title: Ideal stop for ExCel
text: Was attending a fitness event at ExCel was close enough to be able to walk to the ExCel, tube station within walking distance too. Breakfast was slightly limited could do with adding more fruit and variety of cereals.

title: Afternoon Tea
text: Recently been here twice for afternoon tea with several people. Lovely food, variety of sandwiches, little cakes and scones are wonderful. Definitely go again!

title: Brunch treat
text: Recently went here for the first time as I have heard people rave about it. We ordered the full breakfast which included fried egg, toast, bacon, sausage patty, tomato, harsh brown, mushrooms and baked beans. It didn't take too long to arrive but the mushrooms were pretty cold and the fried egg had been put on the toast which was annoying as had i known that i would have asked it not to have been as it made the toast soggy.

title: REASONABLE PRICED STAY
text: Stayed here with a friend one night after attending a pop concert at Genting arena. Idea location as only across the road from the arena and close to transport links. Rooms were big enough, clean and tidy.

title: Fab zoo
text: Love visiting zoos and was not disappointed by this one! Loved watching the kangaroo especially, was fortunate enough to see the croc who has sadly since passed away. There are fab picnic areas so you can bring food and save money on over priced food.

title: PARADISE
text: A little taste of paradise...stayed here for 5 nights in one of the water villas. Was a fantastic resort, water taxi from mainland Malaysia to the resort where you are made to feel like a celebrate. The service is fantastic and can not fault anything. The spa was the best part!

title: Define little...
text: As the name says...ensure you know what your looking for as you might miss it..! Once quite disappointed by the size of the mermaid expected it to be bigger than it once. Once you get off the hop on hop off bus you will be able to find as the area no doubt will be surrounded by other tourists.

title: FANASTIC DAY TRIP
text: Was staying in Zadar and got the bus from there to the fall , was a very busy location as middle of the summer. But most enjoyable trip to the waterfalls where you can bathe or do a hike.

title: Must see
text: No trip to Amsterdam is complete without visiting Anne Franks House the sad story of the Jewish girl and her family hiding from the NAZIS. I found the story very moving and can't imagine what they went through. I had pre booked the trip as the queues are usually very long and managed to find out about a free walking tour around Amsterdam

title: Wowcher stay
text: Purchased a voucher from Wowcher for 1 nights stay Â£99 evening meal, bed and breakfast for 2. Once we found the hotel which was terrible in the dark the hotel was busy with a coach partying at check in at the same time. But the receptionist was, efficient we stayed in room 3 which was near the bar area but we had no problem. The evening meal was brilliant the lamb was very tender and tasty. Breakfast you could help yourself to and was not over greasy at all. Would defiantly book again .

title: Time for tea
text: Quick visit to BOW drop in here for a cup of tea which was lovely and very reasonable priced. Will be back for cake next time!

title: Fab model village
text: Recently visited this on the way back from Oxford with my mother would had visited it many decades ago with my grandparents. Fantastic little model village which has recently been taken over , well kept and the New model Manor house looks great. We Will definitely be returning in the summer when all the other attractions and shops are open.

title: Quick Stop for tea
text: Quick stop on the way to the Old Town, decor looked amazing from outside and inside was pretty impressive. Ordered an english breakfast tea, sadly drinks in Prague don't seem to be used with boiling water, more like warm water.

title: Not for fainted hearted
text: Wanted to experience something a bit different during our trip to Prague. Very informative but quite a small museum, not sure if it is value for money as it is so small, good place for a rainy day.

title: Great Views of Prague
text: Fantastic views of Prague once you conquer the steep stair case. To reach the very top it cost 100CZK which was well worth it. The room before entering the outside show cases the original stone statues.

title: Good location for visiting Prague
text: Stayed here for 3 nights with a friend, we both had our own seperate rooms that were adjoining. Sadly you could hear quite a lot from the kettle being boiled to telephone conversations from the other rooms. The rooms were however spacious only annoying thing was the bathroom light was on a sensor, so you could be in the shower and it would go off, quite dangerous. Breakfast was one of the best I have ever had from a hotel, plenty of choice and variety. The hotel is only 5/10 mins on the tram which is just literally outside the hotel.

title: Wonder Old Town Square
text: Wonderful Old Town Prague , fabulous for wondering around and taking pictures of the astrological clock , churches and old buildings.
place: Old Town Hall with Astronomical Clock

title: Great Hidden Gem
text:
On our last morning my friend and I were looking for a last minute coffee and cake place we found this hidden gem! Absolutely amazing cakes! And so cheap ! 148 Czk for a pot of tea and mixed berry cake as yum, my friend had a raw cake
! Was good too! Only down side was wish we had found this sooner!

title: Walking Tour Of Prague @ zero degrees ðŸ˜±
text:
My friend and I were visiting Prague for the rich history and culture so we decided to book a walking tour . Previously did a free walking tour in Amsterdam and was a lot of fun so was hoping this was too! We had Kenny as our guide , an American who had been living in Prague for a year . The tour started in the Old Tour and ended near Charles Bridge, we learn the history of the Old Town , the wars Czech has encountered and how Czechia it today . The tour is roughly 3 hours long with a stop approx 30 mins . The tour was very informative and lots of does and donâ€™t were
Given .

title: Absolutely awesome!
text:
Visited Prague castle as you can not visit this city without seeing the most medieval castle in Europe . You can visit the grounds for free but during winter October-March the gardens are closed . We purchased the B ticket which was 250Czk got to visit
St. Vitus Cathedral, St. Georgeâ€™s basilica and Golden Lane . The walk up to the place was straight forward the tram stop is roughly 10 mins if that from the entrance .

title: Good for one night .
text: Close to London city airport ,stayed here as was the cheapest hotel I could find for an event attending . Hotel was easy to find however no eateries close by so need get something in the city . Hotel was clean and tidy .

title: Decent pub food
text: Local pub , love their roast dinners especially. But the prawn cocktail is always my fav for a starter.

title: Best cheese and bean jacket potato in town!
text: Always love coming in for a mid week treat every now and then . Always have the same-cheese and bean jacket potato but always nice with home made coleslaw and side salad . Have however had the toasted paninis, soups and pasta always friendly service. Recently have improved the kitchen area but prices donâ€™t seem to have increased.

title: Fav local hot stop
text: As a local eatery the staff are very helpful, friendly and the food is lovely. And the great thing is dogs are welcome in the bar area . Fresh orange juice and the one pot wonder breakfast are my fav !

title: Lovely old town
text: Visited Bilbao for a long weekend . Spent most of our time wondering, eating in the old town , pleasant cafes and surrounding. Nice not to be bothered with people wanting you to buy things. Nice walk to the cathedral which is beautiful inside .

title: Lovely food market
text: Lovely little food market in Bilbao where you can sample traditional Spanish food . Seemed very popular with locals and tourists a like. You can have paella-fish or chicken , fresh fish is on display.

title: Fantastic bakery
text: Fantastic little tea shop right near Teatro Arriaga . Delicious cakes , plenty of choice and perfect tea . English breakfast is fabulous and Iâ€™m British so love my tea

title: Unfriendly staff
text: We stayed 3nights here. The location was good as central and near metro. The receptionist on arrival was grumpy. There is a buffet for breakfast which had a large selection of food and drinks. There is also a cafeteria which serves Tapas and evening meals but watch out if you only want a drink after 6pm even with the place over half empty you canâ€™t sit at a table to drink it. We went in for a meal our last night at 7pm and was told only tapas even though others were looking at menus as they donâ€™t serve until 8.30 and the restaurant didnâ€™t open until 9pm. First morning at breakfast it was drop this and that by one member of staff, very noisy. You got the feeling you were not wanted. What they need to remember is no customers no job. Be a bit more friendly and we may come back.

title: Internal Tour
text: On the morning of September 30th we did the morning tour of inside the theatre which was fascinating! The tour guide was very informative and let us take as many photos as we liked . The structure and art of inside the building was most delightful . The tour was only â‚¬5 pp which we felt was worth it.

title: The visit that wasnâ€™t beware !
text: After paying our entrance fee got to the entrance and were stopped from entry as our backpack was too large. They had an airport style measure of bag and as ours was to tall though it was half empty were told it had to be placed in the cloakroom. With no other way other than our hands to carry phones, purses, and cameraâ€™s we refused to leave it there. No signs mention this size issue at the pay desk. We got our money back so weâ€™re ready using a different bag when visiting the maritime museum but they didnâ€™t have any size issues.

title: Interesting Maritime
text: On arrival at the desk the lady assistant was most helpful and with very good English not something we had come across up to now. She explained how to go round the museum without having to pay extra for the information guide. Even though it was a Saturday was very quiet inside and we enjoyed the time there very much so. The only downside was finding the place. Look for the RED crane and when looking over the water to the dry dock you are possibly standing on the roof of the museum.

title: Best Tapas in Bilbao
text: Went here for dinner on a Friday night wanted to try Tapas , this restaurant stood out from the rest as was offering a taster menu for only â‚¬30 pp. Which include cheeks which is a delicacy in Bilbao. The service was polite, efficient and courteous. The bill came to â‚¬71 this included a lovely red Rioja which complimented the food well .

title: Best Paella in Bilbao
text:
After endless searches came across this corner cafe . By chance came across Paella on the menu for only â‚¬8! Bargain ! Simply delicious ! And you only needed to buy one bowl rather than order for minimum of 2 ppl
.

title: Death by chocolate
text: Was recommended this place from Lonely Planet and they were right ! Hot chocolate is to die for , only â‚¬2.30 very rich and hot ! We also had Pastel Arroz were also very yummy ! Definitely would recommend! Hardest decision is what to eat !

title: Not what I Expected
text:
After reading a review from Lonely Planet about how good the food was we were very disappointed with not only the food but the service was absolutely shocking ! We had the lunch time Special which was only â‚¬12 but this was the only thing they offered lunch times . I had cauliflower cheese to start with and tuna lasagna for the main course . The tuna had what looked to have been reheated in the microwave . My mum had a chicken salad and before she had finished she was asked if she was ready for the main course! The oils which were placed on the table before our starters arrived were taken suddenly whilst stilling using them for the salad!

Food was served luke warm , which was warmer than the staffs attitude! Will definitely not be returning again !

title: Relaxing lunch
text: After a morning at Krka waterfalls I was looking for a relaxing lunch , certainly found this at the restaurant, had a lunch lunch of white fish and a side salad. Definitely would the walk up the hill !

title: Fab
text: Big fan of walking tours , this tour was fantastic! The guide Sime is very knowledgeable about the history of Zadar taking us to some of the famous sites and also recommendations, Sime is generally interested in all people that take part in the tour . There was only 4 other members in the tour so it was very intimate which was lovely. We visited a local market selling fresh fruit and a cheese shop which we were all able to try such a lovely afternoon ! Thank you

title: Good stay but poor breakfast
text: Average hotel paid Â£50 for a night in London don't expect the Ritz! Hotel was clean and tidy, good location as near Canning Town tube station . Breakfast was very disappointed, very little choice. Staff are very friendly.
place: Holiday Inn Express London Royal Docks - Docklands

title: Great budget hotel
text: Stayed here for one night as was planning on seeing Take That but was cancelled due to Manchester Attack , close to train station , very clean and well presented hotel. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Disappointed
text: Have visited here once before but was extremely busy so wanted to give it another try. Was only a few tables full but serves seemed quiet slow when ordering food and drinks and there was only 2 of us. Starters are huge in size (I want value for money of course, but don't want to waste food). Don't agree with the serving charge, I know its optional but I feel its a personal thing whether you should leave a tip or not.

title: Wonder
text: Booked a last minute tour to Oxford with my mum for a few days , both Inspector Morse and Lewis fans so when the idea of this tour came up couldn't resist ! Heidi was our guide , can't recommend her enough ! She was truly wonderful and very informative. 10/10

title: EXCELLENT HOTEL FOR SHORT BREAK
text: Recently stayed at the hotel for a short break, hotel was very clean and tidy. Good location not to far away from the park and ride into Oxford. Only downside I felt the hotel lacked was the hotel bar offered very limited meal choice.

title: EXCELLENY HOTEL
text: I was booked to stay at this hotel for a work conference, excellent location within walking distance of the tube station. Staff were most helpful especially Nicki (sorry if I have spelt your name wrong). There are no tea and coffee facilities in the room but there is free use in the reception. Rooms are small but adequate for a single person, very clean and quiet.
place: hub by Premier Inn London Westminster, St James's Park hotel

title: MORSE BAR
text: Visited Oxford for a few days, obviously has to visit the famous Morse Bar before our Inspector Morse tour. I was very disappointed to discover the amount of dust in the bar area! Glad I wasn't paying to stay at the hotel!
place: The Randolph Hotel, by Graduate Hotels

title: FAV CAFE ROUGE
text: Always visit this place on my visits to London, excellent location after getting off the bus at Victoria. The service is always quick and excellent even when they are busy!

title: FAB LOCATION
text: I stayed here on a trip to London whilst I was seeing a show at the West End. Excellent location walking distance of Westminster Bridge. Had one of the best night sleepers whilst staying at hotel;) Breakfast was OK, nothing special for the price paid.

title: GREAT LOCATION
text: Stayed here for 2 nights before Christmas. Very close to Hero's Square which I could see from my room. The hop on hop off bus is situated very close to the hotel which is a great way to see the city, the metro is close by and very easy to use. The room was satisfactory but not wow. Breakfast was very interesting with plenty of choice.
